body_html: TensorFlow officially supports CUDA 9.0. However it is compatible with CUDA 10.0 but not supported currently. For using TF with cuda 10, you have to build it from sources yourself. You need to update the "./configure.py" file with appropriate CUDA, cuDNN versions. You can also take a look at installations done by another users to make it work.
body_text: TensorFlow officially supports CUDA 9.0. However it is compatible with CUDA 10.0 but not supported currently. For using TF with cuda 10, you have to build it from sources yourself. You need to update the "./configure.py" file with appropriate CUDA, cuDNN versions. You can also take a look at installations done by another users to make it work.
body: TensorFlow officially supports CUDA 9.0. However it is compatible with CUDA 10.0 but not supported currently. For using TF with cuda 10, you have to build it from sources yourself. You need to update the **"./configure.py"** file with appropriate CUDA, cuDNN versions. You can also take a look at [installations](https://medium.com/@vitali.usau/install-cuda-10-0-cudnn-7-3-and-build-tensorflow-gpu-from-source-on-ubuntu-18-04-3daf720b83fe) done by another users to make it work.
